sub_title: I believe language ability and cultural awareness are crucial for the hospitality industry. I have lived in the countries where have diverse cultures for 19 years. Also, I can speak Korean, Chinese, and English fluently.
summary:
I am a first year student pursuing International hotel management bachelor's degree at NHL Stenden University of Applied Sciences. I have experienced a variety of cultures since I was young because I have lived in China for twelve years, 7 years in Malaysia, and now I am living in the Netherlands. China, Malaysia, and Netherlands are large countries that are popular for the variety of rich cultures and races, which I believe is crucial for hospitality industry. Also, I can speak three different languages-Chinese, Korean, and English-fluently. I believe having language skills are essential in hospitality industry as well because we must offer service to people from different parts of the world.

I am studying international hotel management because I love interacting with people from various fields, which can help me to broaden my perspective. Also, I was always interested in how a place where we normally visit as a guest, like a hotel, is actually running behind and attracting the people around the world since I was young. Thus, I am pursuing Hospitality at NHL Stenden of Applied science. 

I am currently working part-time in one of the biggest Asian restaurants in Leeuwarden as an assistant chef. I always serve my guests as the way I wanted to be served because that is the only way I believe that I am trying my best. Furthermore, I take humility very seriously because there are a lot of people who want respect and compliment from the public but not willing to sacrifice themselves sincerely and quietly for the organization. Also, trust is substantial because I believe we cannot achieve any astounding accomplishment without trusting each other in the hospitality industry.

I did not prefer the strict and limited educational system in Chinese school, so I had chosen to study most things by my own when I was in the eighth grade in school. As a result, I have become a person who is more responsible and know how to self-study and manage my time efficiently. For example, I passed the Korean GDE (General Educational Development) and I have gotten one hundred in Toefl Exam by learning english from watching dramas and memorizing vocabulary books by myself by using the schedules that I made myself. 

After I finish my bachelor’s degree, I am eager to work in the marketing department of a hotel chain where I can use my language skills and cultural awareness most efficiently. Therefore, if you are interested to have a conversation about different cultures and languages and their benefits in hotel management, send me a message. I would like to hear from you.

profile_positions.description: I am working part-time in one of the biggest asian restaurant in the Leeuwarden as an assistant chef. My main job in the restaurant is to assist the chefs during the cooking, such as cutting meat, making Chinese sandwich, and heating dumplings. All of the chefs in the restaurant are Chinese, which is the reason why the restaurant hired me because I speak fluent Chinese and I know how to communicate with them in the right way.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Chef
